fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: Attacks on the judiciary’s integrity can include claims that it is corrupt, incompetent or that decisions were politically motivated. These attacks can manifest in various ways including, but not limited to prepared statements reported by the media, press conferences, interviews, and stump speeches.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: How often did the government attack the judiciary’s integrity in public?

fxInfo_responses.value: Attacks were carried out on a daily or weekly basis.
Attacks were common and carried out in nearly every month of the year.
There were attacks, but they were rare.
There were no attacks on the judiciary’s integrity.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2jupoatck, *_osp, *_ord
